original_title: Sri Lanka t-bill yields fall across maturities at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 110 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Tuesday after offering 110 billion while yields across maturities fell, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold all of the offered 60 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 24.12 percent, down 187 basis points from a week earlier.
Only 14.1 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 24.10 percent, down 169 basis points from a week earlier.
35.8 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.37 percent, down 176 basis points from a week earlier after offering only 20 billion. (Colombo/April04/2022)
